+        /// <summary>
+        /// Implements: 008:UX-002
+        /// When ghost text is visible with only one matching option and user presses Tab,
+        /// the ghost text is accepted and cursor moves to end of inserted text.
+        /// </summary>
+        [TestMethod]
+        public async Task TabAcceptsSingleOption_GhostTextAccepted_CursorAtEnd()
+        {
+            // Arrange - use myCommand which is the only command starting with "myc"
+            // This ensures there's exactly one matching option
+            _input.Write("myc");
+
+            // Act - trigger autocomplete (shows ghost text preview)
+            await _acCtrl.Begin(_input);
+            
+            // Verify ghost text is showing (preview state)
+            _input.Buffer.Should().Be("myCommand");
+            _acCtrl.IsEngaged.Should().BeTrue("autocomplete should be engaged with ghost text");
+
+            // Simulate Tab press by calling Accept()
+            _acCtrl.Accept(_input);
+
+            // Assert
+            // 1. Ghost text is now accepted (permanent in buffer)
+            _input.Buffer.Should().Be("myCommand", 
+                "Tab should accept the single matching option");
+
+            // 2. Cursor should be at end of inserted text
+            _input.BufferPosition.Should().Be("myCommand".Length,
+                "cursor should move to end of inserted text after Tab");
+
+            // 3. Autocomplete should be disengaged (no more ghost text mode)
+            _acCtrl.IsEngaged.Should().BeFalse("autocomplete should disengage after Tab accept");
+        }
+
         #endregion
